pullRequest.body:
- add `finsupport`: the support (the set of indices which functions are non-vanishing) at a point, as a `Finset`
- every point has a neighbourhood on which only finitely many functions are non-vanishing

From sphere-eversion; I'm just upstreaming results.

Thanks!

Please feel free to merge after applying the suggestions.

bors d+

Thanks!

Please feel free to merge after applying the suggestions.

bors d+

Spawning a new goal from a rewrite with a missing hypothesis should be avoided. How about:
```suggestion
  rw [← ρ.sum_eq_one hx₀, finsum_eq_sum_of_support_subset _ (ρ.coe_finsupport x₀).superset]
```
Much better! TIL.

I like this idea but we don't do it elsewhere in the library so I'd leave it out for now
```suggestion
    (hx₀ : x₀ ∈ s) :
```
and raise it in Zulip if you're interested enough

We prefer whitespace after a section heading. Also this comment is a bit of a mouthful. Finally, every def / theorem in this section has the same arguments so let's use variables. Thus how about:
```suggestion

variable {s : Set X} (ρ : PartitionOfUnity ι X s) (x₀ : X)

/-- The support of a partition of unity at a point `x₀` as a `Finset`. -/
```
and then I guess you'll need to add:
```
variable {x₀}
```
in between `mem_finsupport` and `sum_finsupport`.
Changed. The explanation of "support" felt helpful to me, hence I had added it. I have demoted it to a parenthetical now.

As above
```suggestion
    (hx₀ : x₀ ∈ s) {I : Finset ι} (hI : ρ.finsupport x₀ ⊆ I) :
```

Optional:
```suggestion
  rw [finsupport, Finite.coe_toFinset, setOf_set]
```

After adding `variable` above
```suggestion
def finsupport : Finset ι := (ρ.locallyFinite.point_finite x₀).toFinset
```
and likewise everywhere below.

```suggestion
  suffices ∑ i in I \ ρ.finsupport x₀, (ρ i) x₀ = ∑ i in I \ ρ.finsupport x₀, 0 by
    rw [this, add_left_eq_self, Finset.sum_const_zero]
```

```suggestion

end finsupport
```

I slightly prefer avoiding the `erw`
```suggestion
  have : (fun i ↦ (ρ i) x₀ • φ i x₀) = (fun i ↦ (ρ i) x₀) • (fun i ↦ φ i x₀) := rfl
  rw [ρ.coe_finsupport x₀, this, support_smul]
```
but only slightly because I was hoping we had a lemma for what I've called `this` above but it seems not.

Given that the whole point of this lemma is to obtain a `finsum`, I think it should appear in the name:
```suggestion
theorem sum_finsupport_smul_eq_finsum {s : Set X} (ρ : PartitionOfUnity ι X s) {x₀ : X}
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: lemmas about partitions of unity
